content.description: Sit start on the large rails with a giant foot. Pull on and move up to the arete/ lip, then head right and traverse the lip to the apex and top out. A nice little warm up.
content.protection: a pad if you need it.
content.location: This problem is found closer to the parking lot than the Bolted Boulder. When looking at the two bolts on the big block, spin around 180 degrees and this is the small boulder a short distance away..

content.description: Sit start on a right hand slot and left hand blocky pinch. Use a funky pocket and figure out some feet to hit a good hold at the top, exit right out the slab. Surprisingly fun lowball!
content.location: From the Bolted Boulder, walk right and uphill about 50 feet. This climb is found on the uphill side of the boulder.Â

content.description: This is yet another large block that is found the closest to the parking. It is home to a V-Easy slab and one other problem. There seems to be some potential for additional climbs on great rock with the removal of dead, smashed up trees.   This boulder is also home to the adjacent boulder which has a nice fun V1 warm-up on it.
